title: Maxim Integrated stock jumps after chip maker's earnings beat expectations
text: Maxim Integrated Products Inc. MXIM, +1.17% shares gained more than 8% in after-hours trading Tuesday after the chip maker's earnings came in ahead of expectations. Maxim reported fiscal first-quarter earnings of $140.2 million, or 51 cents a share, on sales of $533 million, down from $577 million a year ago. After adjusting for restructuring and other effects, the company reported earnings of 52 cents a share, down from 75 cents a share a year ago. Analysts on average expected Maxim to report adjusted earnings of 49 cents a share on sales of $530.8 million amid a broad chip downturn. The company projected second-quarter adjusted earnings of 49 cents to 57 cents a share on revenue of $525 million to $565 million, which was also ahead of average analyst estimates that called for adjusted earnings of 51 cents a share on sales of $535 million.
